intro: Canthium vollesenii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by leaf-like bracts. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Canthium vollesenii is typically herbaceous, though some varieties may have a slight woody base.
